locationSection.intro: Los Alcazares has emerged as one of Murcia's most sought-after coastal destinations, offering an authentic blend of Spanish charm and modern convenience. This charming Mediterranean town provides direct access to some of the region's most beautiful Blue Flag beaches while maintaining a relaxed, authentic Spanish lifestyle. The area has attracted a substantial international community—primarily British, German, and Scandinavian residents—who appreciate the year-round sunshine, affordable cost of living, and exceptional quality of life. Los Alcazares features excellent healthcare facilities with a regional hospital within 30 minutes, making it ideal for families and retirees. The town offers abundant dining, shopping, and entertainment options, from local Spanish tapas bars to international restaurants. With Alicante Airport just 30 minutes away, international connectivity is seamless. Property values here have appreciated 8% year-on-year, significantly outperforming broader market trends, while remaining 40% more affordable than comparable developments on Spanish islands.

faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely buy property in Spain without restrictions. EU citizens require only an NIE number, while non-EU buyers follow a straightforward process involving fiscal number registration and documentation. Spain's transparent property laws and established legal framework make it accessible for international investors. Our team can guide you through all legal requirements.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, budget for additional costs typically ranging 8-10% including: Transfer tax (6-10% depending on region), Notary fees (0.5-1%), Property registry fees, and legal costs. Murcia's transfer tax rates are competitive. Our advisors provide detailed cost breakdowns and can connect you with specialist legal and tax professionals familiar with international buyer requirements.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: No visa is required specifically to purchase property in Spain. However, if you plan to relocate, different visa categories exist: Non-lucrative visas for retirees, Digital nomad visas, and residency options. EU citizens enjoy freedom of movement. We recommend consulting with immigration specialists to understand residency requirements aligned with your personal circumstances and timeline.

faqs.question: How much are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Spain's property taxes are reasonable: Annual property tax (IBI) typically 0.4-0.6% of cadastral value; Capital gains tax applies to investment property sales; and rental income is taxed as personal income. Murcia region offers competitive rates. We recommend engaging a gestoría (Spanish tax advisor) familiar with international owner requirements to optimize tax efficiency and ensure compliance with Spanish and your home country regulations.
